articles.title: Int'l Women's Delegation Visits International Friendship Exhibition House
articles.content:
Int'l Women's Delegation Visits International Friendship Exhibition House
 Pyongyang, May 22 (KCNA) -- Members of a delegation to take part in the 2015 international women's grand march for the reunification and peace in Korea visited the International Friendship Exhibition House on Friday. 
					 They paid tribute to President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il before their wax replicas.
					
					 They looked round the gifts presented to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un by party, state and government leaders and famous personages of many countries of the world.

articles.title: National Sports Contest of Juvenile Sports Schools Open
articles.content:
National Sports Contest of Juvenile Sports Schools Open
 Mundok, May 22 (KCNA) -- The 52nd National Sports Contest of Juvenile Sports Schools opened with due ceremony at Mundok County Gymnasium in South Phyongan Province on Friday.
					 The participants will compete in more than 30 events including football, basketball, volleyball, table tennis, weightlifting and judo. The games will be held in cities such as Pyongyang, Phyongsong, Hamhung, Sariwon, Nampho, Jongju and Kaechon and counties including Mundok and Sonchon.

articles.title: Girls' Football Festival Held
articles.content:
Girls' Football Festival Held
 Pyongyang, May 22 (KCNA) -- A girls' football festival took place here on the occasion of the AFC Grassroot's Day (May 15).
					 Given at the festival was a course on the training method of basic football techniques with the attendance of 9-12 year-old girls and coaches of juvenile sports schools.
					
					 A demonstration of football techniques was staged by trainees of Pyongyang International Football School, which was followed by girl footballers' display of dribbling, kicking and other techniques.
					
					 According to Kim Sang Hyop, deputy department director of the DPRK Football Association, the festival marked an important occasion in raising the professional qualifications of coaches and encouraging more schoolchildren to learn football.

articles.title: National Children's Football Contest Opens in DPRK
articles.content:
National Children's Football Contest Opens in DPRK
 Pyongyang, May 22 (KCNA) -- The second national children's football contest began with due ceremony at Kim Il Sung Stadium on Friday.
					 Football teams (boy and girl) selected from Pyongyang and provinces will play league matches in various parts of Pyongyang till May 30. And the finals will be held at the Songdowon International Children's Camp on June 4.
					
					 Present at the ceremony were Kim Sung Du, chairman of the Education Commission, Kim Yong Hun, minister of Physical Culture and Sports, officials of the youth league, teachers and schoolchildren.
					
					 Jon Yong Nam, chairman of the Central Committee of the youth league, made an opening address.
					
					 The ceremony was followed by a boys' demonstration football match between the Pyongyang City Team and the South Hwanghae Provincial Team.

articles.title: Premier Soccer League for Mangyongdae Prize Held
articles.content:
Premier Soccer League for Mangyongdae Prize Held
 Pyongyang, May 22 (KCNA) -- The premier soccer league of Mangyongdae Prize Sports Games came to an end. It has been under way since the end of March.
					 The first round of the league was over late in April.
					
					 Finals of the second round of  men's soccer league between the April 25 Team and the Kigwancha Team took place at Kim Il Sung Stadium and finals of the second round of the women's soccer league between the Sobaeksu Team and the Pyongyang Team at May Day Stadium.
					
					 The April 25 Team came first in the men's games and the Sobaeksu Team in the women's games of the second round of the league.
					
					 The April 25 Men's Team and the Sobaeksu Women's Team placed first in the total standings of the premier soccer league respectively.

articles.title: Scientific Successes Scored in Fishery Field
articles.content:
Scientific Successes Scored in Fishery Field
 Pyongyang, May 22 (KCNA) -- Scientific successes have been achieved in fishery field of the DPRK.
					 One of them is a new shoal detector developed by the Branch Academy of Fishery. It is simple in its structure and convenient to use in fishing grounds of different conditions. It can be also used for aquaculture.
					
					 Meanwhile, the Global Environmental Information Institute under the State Academy of Sciences established a new fish-detecting system depending on meteorological information sent from satellite.

articles.title: New Disinfectant for Mushroom Cultivation Developed
articles.content:
New Disinfectant for Mushroom Cultivation Developed
 Pyongyang, May 22 (KCNA) -- The High-Tech Institute of Kim Il Sung University in the DPRK made a new kind of disinfectant for mushroom cultivation.
					 This disinfectant was appreciated at the 30th National Festival of Science and Technology held recently in the country.
					
					 According to Kim Ji Song, a developer of the disinfectant, it helps clean up mushroom cultivation rooms with less effort and sterilize mushroom spore without autoclave. And it has a strong durability in its effect.
					
					 The new disinfectant has been already applied in mushroom production bases, proving very effective.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Blasts Park Geun Hye's Outbursts against DPRK
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Blasts Park Geun Hye's Outbursts against DPRK
 Pyongyang, May 22 (KCNA) -- Park Geun Hye of south Korea on May 19 pulled up the DPRK, asserting that it harasses the stability and development through nuclear threat, provocation and isolation and that it is escalating military tension through test-fire of SLBM. She went the lengths of crying out for "strongly reacting against it" and begging the international community to cooperate in "the settlement of the nuclear issue of the north and its human rights issue."
					  Commenting on this, Rodong Sinmun Friday says: Park's invectives clearly prove that she has neither decency nor qualifications as the chief executive.
					
					 There had been not a few south Korean rulers who have earned an ill-fame for escalating confrontation with the compatriots in the north but Park is the worst confrontation maniac.
					
					 Park is not entitled to be the boss of Chongwadae from the very beginning as she does not have even the slightest goodwill toward the compatriots in the north and is narrow-minded and prejudiced in her view on the issue of the inter-Korean relations and judgment of the trend of the situation.
					
					 She is sadly mistaken if she thinks that she can tarnish the image of the dignified DPRK and undermine the single-minded unity of its service personnel and people by misleading the public opinion through her poor tongue-lashing.
					
					 With no sleight of hand can she put under the carpet the grave human rights situation in south Korea.
					
					 She is, indeed, shame on the nation, source of trouble and cancer-like existence hindering the improvement of the north-south relations as she works with blood-shot eyes to do harm to the compatriots at any cost in disregard of the aspiration of all Koreans and the demand of the times. It is of urgent necessity to remove such malignant tumor in order to get rid of trouble.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Raps Japan for Tampering with Its Past History
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Raps Japan for Tampering with Its Past History
 Pyongyang, May 22 (KCNA) -- Takashi Uemura, a former journalist of Asahi Shimbun, said in a recent lecture at New York University that the sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army was a historical fact, urging the Japanese government to apologize for it without fail. 
					 Commenting on this, Rodong Sinmun Friday observes that what he said echoes the voices representing conscience and truth coming out from the turbulent political climate in Japan. 
					
					 No matter how desperately the Japanese ruling quarters and the right-wing reactionary forces work to make profound confusing of right and wrong, they can never falsify the truth of history, the commentary notes, and goes on:
					
					 Last year the chairman of the Policy Research Council of the Liberal Democratic Party of Japan blustered that he would ask the chief Cabinet Secretary to release a new statement on the lapse of 70 years since the end of the Second World War, at the party meeting held to discuss the issue of the government report on the Kono statement. The Japanese chief executive is working overtly and covertly to make public a new statement distorting and embellishing the crimes related to the sexual slavery and its past history of aggression. During his junket to the U.S. he described the victims of the sexual slavery as "victims of flesh traffic" and claimed that the sexual slavery was the result of flesh traffic. This was a revelation of his cynical ploy to play down the gravity of the past crimes in the new statement.
					
					 Japan, however, should clearly know that the forces desirous of properly clarifying historical truth and protecting it are stronger than those trying to distort and embellish its past history.
					
					 This is evidenced by mass demonstrations staged in the U.S. in demand of Japan's apology for its crime-woven past history during the Japanese chief executive's U.S. trip. There are not a few fair-minded personalities like Takashi Uemura not only in Japan but in other countries of the world.
					
					 Japan would be well advised to bear in mind that its bid to hide its past crimes would only lead it to further isolation and ruin.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Accuses Japan of Its Brazen-faced Bid
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Accuses Japan of Its Brazen-faced Bid
 Pyongyang, May 22 (KCNA) -- Japan is craftily working to have the places where the Japanese imperialists perpetrated crimes against Koreans and other people in the world registered as UNESCO world cultural heritages.
					 They cooked up a relevant document by describing them as "industrial structures that contributed to the modernization of Japan."  They are working hard to have it finally examined at the 39th meeting of the World Heritage Committee of the UNESCO.
					
					 This is an extremely base act to justify the Japanese imperialists' 40- odd year-long military occupation of Korea and another unpardonable hideous crime against humanity.
					
					 The above-said places bear witness to the misfortune and pain suffered by Koreans under the Japanese imperialists' colonial rule.
					
					 At least 7,000 young and middle-aged Koreans were forced to do slave labor baffling human imagination at the Mitsubishi Shipyard and only one man survived when the Hashima Coal Mine was abandoned.
					
					 The Mitsubishi Shipyard and Hashima Coal Mine are among the industrial establishments that raked up huge profits at the cost of the blood and sweat of Koreans and other Asian people conscripted by the Japanese imperialists.
					
					 The above-said bid of Japan is, indeed, a reckless act against humanity and a shameless brigandish act quite contrary to common sense. 
					
					 Japan is the only country which has refused to redress its past history in the new century though it committed thrice-cursed crimes against the Korean people. Yet, it is trying hard to advertise those grudge-bearing sites. 
					
					 What Japan is doing goes to clearly prove that it is no more than a political pigmy and morally depraved country.
					
					 What we would like to emphasize is that the past history of aggression can neither be written off nor be justified no matter how hard Japan may deny or embellish it.
					
					 Japan's base move censured and rejected by world people is quite contrary to the purpose and spirit of the world cultural heritage registration. 
					
					 Tokyo's hectic diplomacy would only bring shame to it. It is a mockery of world cultural heritage to allow such bid.
					
					 The souls of Korean ancestors who met death with their grudge unsettled still haunt the above-said sites. Japan's move to have those places registered as "heritages" and attract tourists can never be pardoned.
					
					 The brazen-faced move of Japan will only touch off stronger protest and criticism among the Asian people including Koreans.

articles.title: U.S. Accused of Paving Way for Japan's Reinvasion
articles.content:
U.S. Accused of Paving Way for Japan's Reinvasion
 Pyongyang, May 22 (KCNA) -- The People for Achieving Peace and Reunification of south Korea and dozens of other civic and social organizations in south Korea held a joint press conference in Seoul on May 18 to denounce the U.S. for paving the way for Japan's comeback to Korea.
					 They censured the U.S. for revising the "U.S.-Japan defense cooperation guidelines" to help Japan exercise the "right to collective self-defense" throughout Korea and thereby paving the way for its reinvasion of Korea.
					
					 They urged the authorities not to yield to the U.S. pressure.
					
					 On the same day members of the People for Achieving Peace and Reunification staged a demonstration in front of Chongwadae.

articles.title: Japanese Police Authorities' Crackdown upon Officials of Chongryon Slammed
articles.content:
Japanese Police Authorities' Crackdown upon Officials of Chongryon Slammed
 Tokyo, May 21 (KNS-KCNA) -- Officials of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) in Kyoto, Osaka, Hyogo, Shiga, Nara and Wakayama on May 18 launched an action outside the building of the Kyoto Prefectural Police Headquarters in protest against the Japanese police authorities' unreasonable arrest of Chongryon officials. 
					 Kim Hak Bok, chairman of the Kyoto Prefectural Headquarters of Chongryon, who headed the protest group, read out a protest letter.
					
					 The letter recalled that the Joint Investigation Headquarters under the Kyoto Prefectural Police Headquarters staged an operation to arrest officials of Chongryon under the pretext of the violation of the "law on foreign exchange" on May 12 in a despicable effort to discourage Koreans in Japan alive with a drive to greet the 60th anniversary of the formation of Chongryon, adding they would never tolerate the move.
					
					 It demanded the police authorities stop the vicious politically-motivated crackdown upon Koreans in Japan and human rights abuses and immediately release the groundlessly arrested Koreans in Japan.
					
					Then, the participants in the protest action thronged to the Fushimi, Yamashina and Ukyo police stations to lodge a strong protest with the police authorities against their brutal crackdown upon Chongryon.

articles.title: Swiss Bodies' Joint Statement Marks Anniversary of Kwangju Popular Uprising
articles.content:
Swiss Bodies' Joint Statement Marks Anniversary of Kwangju Popular Uprising
 Pyongyang, May 22 (KCNA) -- The Switzerland-Korea Committee and the Swiss Group for the Study of the Juche Idea released a joint statement on May 13 on the occasion of the 35th anniversary of the Kwangju popular uprising.
					 The statement said that May 18 this year marks the 35th anniversary of heroic Kwangju popular uprising. 
					
					 It went on:
					
					 People in Kwangju of south Korea took to the street against the fascist autocracy and emergency martial law.
					
					 The popular uprising also targeted the U.S. imperialists who subjugated south Korea.
					
					 The U.S. imperialists bended all means to prop up the cruel fascist dictator Chun Doo Hwan's power.
					
					 The pro-U.S. puppet regime brutally quenched the uprising lest the U.S. should not continue to show mercy to it.
					
					 The massacre of people in Kwangju by the pro- U.S. puppet regime was, indeed, a hideous crime against humanity.
					
					 The main culprits of the massacre and its wire-pullers must be prosecuted at the International Criminal Court and punished for their crimes.

articles.title: Russian Organization Slams Japan's Suppression of Chongryon
articles.content:
Russian Organization Slams Japan's Suppression of Chongryon
 Pyongyang, May 22 (KCNA) -- The Russian Association for Friendship and Cultural Cooperation with the DPRK released a statement on May 17 denouncing the Japanese authorities' moves against the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon).
					 The statement denounced the Japanese authorities' violent action against Korean residents in Japan and their patriotic organization Chongryon. 
					
					 It went on:
					
					 Japan's unreasonable action will stir up distrust between Koreans in Japan and the Japanese people.
					
					 It will also entail catastrophic consequences not only on the relations between the DPRK and Japan but on peace and security in the Asia-Pacific region.
					
					 We strongly demand the Japanese authorities stop all suppressions of Chongryon and Koreans in Japan.

articles.title: S. Korean People's Anti-"Government" Struggle Introduced by British Organization
articles.content:
S. Korean People's Anti-"Government" Struggle Introduced by British Organization
 Pyongyang, May 22 (KCNA) -- The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy on May 7 posted on its website the news that the south Korean people are waging a vigorous struggle against the "government" in all parts of south Korea.
					 The website said that more than 50,000 workers and above 200 bereaved family members of the ferry Sewol disaster had a mass rally and a demonstration under the sponsorship of the Confederation of Trade Unions in Seoul on May Day.
					
					 The website went on:
					
					 Over 120,000 workers belonging to the Federation of Trade Unions held a meeting denouncing the puppet authorities for their retrogressive restructuring of the labor market in Seoul and members of the Government Employees' Union waged a stay-in strike in protest against the Park Geun Hye regime's retrogressive revision of pension for government employees on the same day.
					
					 The April 24 general strike of the Confederation of Trade Unions was staged on April 24 and 25 in 17 areas including Seoul, Pusan, Kwangju, Taejon, Taegu, Ulsan and on Jeju Island all at once in order to win the democratic rights and the vital rights in protest against the unpopular rule of the authorities.
					
					 An anti-"government" struggle for defending the right to existence was launched by more than 100,000 people including government employees, teachers, workers, farmers, the poor, youths, women and disabled persons of above 350 civic and public organizations.

articles.title: Park Geun-hye es calamidad de nacion y cancer de mejora de relaciones N-S, califica Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Park Geun-hye es calamidad de nacion y cancer de mejora de relaciones N-S, califica Rodong Sinmun
Pyongyang, 22 de mayo (ACNC) -- El pasado dia 19, la mandataria surcoreana Park Geun-hye insistio en "hacer frente rotundo" a la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea diciendo que esta "impide la estabilidad y el desarrollo con la amenaza nuclear, la provocacion y el aislamiento y aumenta la tension militar" con el lanzamiento de proyecto balistico de submarino y solicito a la sociedad internacional resolver el "problema nuclear y de derechos humanos del Norte de Corea".
					Como vemos, Park Geun-hye es una mujer rustica carente de cualidades de la mandataria.
					
					Ella supera a los gobernantes anteriores surcoreanos que ganaron la mala fama por la confrontacion fratricida. 
					
					No tiene siquiera la minima bondad sobre la parte connacional y trata con vision estrecha y de prejuicio el problema de las relaciones intercoreanas y la tendencia de la epoca. Ella no tiene las cualidades para hacerse duena de Chongwadae.
					
					Seria una gran equivocacion si ella piensa en que con sus maldiciones podria manchar el prestigio de la RPDC y debilitar la unidad monolitica entre los militares y civiles coreanos. 
					
					Ella no puede ocultar con nada la miserable situacion de derechos humanos de la sociedad surcoreana. 
					
					Park se desespera por danar a la parte connacional dando espaldas a la aspiracion nacional y a la demanda de la epoca. 
					
					Hay que eliminar a Park, verguenza y calamidad de la nacion y cancer de la mejora de las relaciones intercoreanas.

articles.title: No se tergiversa la verdad de la historia, afirma Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
No se tergiversa la verdad de la historia, afirma Rodong Sinmun
Pyongyang, 22 de mayo (ACNC) -- En una reciente conferencia en la Universidad de Nueva York de Estados Unidos, el ex periodista de Asahi Shimbun, Takashi Uemura, insistio en que el caso de esclavitud sexual para el viejo ejercito japones es la verdad historica y que el gobierno japones debe pedir disculpa por el respecto. 
					El diario Rodong Sinmun, en un comentario individual de este viernes, lo califica de voz de conciencia que resuena en el circulo politico de Japon, y continua:
					
					Por mas que los gobernantes y los reaccionarios derechistas del pais isla se desesperen por convertir lo negro en lo blanco, no pueden ocultar ni tergiversar la verdad de la historia.
					
					En la reunion del Partido Democratico Liberal de Japon, efectuado en el ano pasado para discutir el informe del gobierno sobre la revision de la Declaracion de Kono, el presidente del Comite de Averiguacion de Asuntos Politicos dijo publicamente que solicitaria la nueva Declaracion del director del secretariado del gabinete con motivo del 70o aniversario del fin de la segunda guerra mundial.
					
					El gobernante japones tambien pretende publicar nueva declaracion tergiversando y embelleciendo la historia de agresion de su pais y el crimen de esclavitud sexual. 
					
					Durante su visita a EE.UU., describio a las victimas del caso de esclavitud sexual como "victimas de trafico de seres humanos". Esto es la expresion de su malsano intento de debilitar en la nueva declaracion la gravedad de los crimenes del pasado de su pais. 
					
					Pero, Japon debe tener presente que la posicion de esclarecer la verdad de la historia es mas fuerte que su intento de tergiversar y embellecer la historia criminal. 
					
					A citar un ejemplo, en el periodo de su gira por EE.UU., se desarrollo en el territorio estadounidense una manifestacion de las masas demandando a Japon pedir perdon por su historia criminal.
					
					Hasta en el interior del pais isla estan muchas personas conscientes como Takashi Uemura que exigen esclarecer y mantener la verdad de la historia.
					
					Japon debe darse clara cuenta de que su intento de ocultar los crimenes del pasado le llevara al aislamiento y al arruinamiento.

articles.title: ACNC denuncia intento de Japon de registrar escenas de crimen como patrimonios culturales mundiales
articles.content:
ACNC denuncia intento de Japon de registrar escenas de crimen como patrimonios culturales mundiales
Pyongyang, 22 de mayo (ACNC) -- Japon actua con astucia para registrar como patrimonios culturales mundiales de la Organizacion de las Naciones Unidas para la Educacion, la Ciencia y la Cultura (UNESCO) las escenas de crimenes cometidos en el siglo pasado por los imperialistas japoneses contra el pueblo coreano y los demas del mundo. 
					Trazo un documento necesario disfrazandolas de "objetos industriales que contribuyeron a la modernizacion de Japon" e intenta someterlo a la consideracion final en la 39a reunion del Comite de Patrimonios Mundiales de la UNESCO.
					
					Esto es el intolerable y grosero crimen antietico tendente a justificar la ocupacion militar de Corea de mas de 40 anos por el imperialismo japones. 
					
					Los lugares que Japon trata de registrar como patrimonios culturales mundiales son testigos historicos sobre las desgracias y sufrimientos del pueblo coreano causados por la dominacion colonial del imperialismo japones. 
					
					Solo en el astillero de Mitsubishi, casi 7 mil adolescentes coreanos sufrieron los inimaginables trabajos de esclavitud, mientras en la mina carbonifera de Hashima sobrevivio solo un hombre coreano en el momento de abandono de la mina.
					
					El astillero de Mitsubishi, la mina carbonifera de Hashima y otros lugares se engordaron y lograron la rehabilitacion economica por la sangre y sudor de los coreanos y los demas asiaticos secuestrados forzosamente. 
					
					Registrar como patrimonios culturales mundiales tales lugares, testigos de las atrocidades del imperialismo japones es un acto cinico, gangsteril y antietico.
					
					Japon es el unico pais que no liquida todavia sus tremendos crimenes cometidos al pueblo coreano. Sin embargo, intenta embellecer los campos de trabajos forzosos y escenas de homicidio donde esta impregnada la sangre de incontables  personas. 
					
					Insatisfecho con la negacion y tergiversacion de la historia criminal, Japon presenta sin escrupulos ante el mundo y la civilizacion moderna las escenas de homicidio como "patrimonios culturales que contribuyeron al resurgimiento industrial de Japon". Esto es el verdadero aspecto de Japon, enano politico e idiota moral. 
					
					La historia de agresion no se cambia ni se justifica con nada.
					
					El vil proceder de Japon provoca gran rechazo de todo el mundo y contraviene a la meta y el espiritu del registro de patrimonios culturales mundiales.  
					
					No puede tolerarse jamas tales actos de las autoridades japonesas tendentes a introducir a los turistas en los lugares donde todavia vagabundea el espiritu de los antepasados coreanos muertos con rencor registrandolos como "patrimonios".
					
					El acto descarado de Japon sera denunciado y rechazado por parte del el pueblo coreano y los demas asiaticos.
